priority.title: Core System and Main Loop (main.c)
priority.description: Document main.c - the entry point and initialization of less. Cover: program initialization flow, command-line argument handling, main event loop structure, cleanup on exit, modules it depends on, modules that depend on it, and key data structures initialized here.

priority.title: Display System (screen.c)
priority.description: Document screen.c - the core display and screen management module. Cover: screen initialization and management, drawing primitives, scrolling logic, screen position tracking, home/end routines, attribute handling (bold, underline, etc.), interface with terminal libraries, key data structures (scrpos, etc.), and functions for screen updates.

priority.title: Input System (input.c, ttyin.c)
priority.description: Document the input handling system. Cover input.c: reading from various sources (files, pipes, stdin), input buffer management; ttyin.c: terminal input handling, special key sequences, raw mode handling. Include dependencies and dependents, key functions, and data structures.

priority.title: Command Processing (command.c, cmdbuf.c)
priority.description: Document the command processing system. Cover command.c: command interpretation and dispatch, multi-key commands, command execution flow; cmdbuf.c: command buffer management, command history. Include: external vs helper functions, command table structure, how commands map to actions, and key data structures.

priority.title: Search Engine (search.c, pattern.c)
priority.description: Document the search and pattern matching system. Cover search.c: search implementation (forward/backward), search context management, search result highlighting; pattern.c: pattern compilation, storage, and management. Include: regex integration, search state tracking, pattern types supported, and key data structures.

priority.title: File Management (ifile.c, filename.c, input.c)
priority.description: Document file management and input file handling. Cover ifile.c: input file structure (IFILE), file list management, current file tracking; filename.c: filename expansion, globbing, path handling; input.c: reading from different input sources. Include file switching logic and the IFILE data structure.

priority.title: Line Buffer Management (line.c)
priority.description: Document line.c - the line buffer management system. Cover: how lines are read and stored, line cache/buffering strategy, line position tracking, raw line vs formatted line handling, memory management for line buffers, POSITION type usage, and key functions for line operations.

priority.title: Options System (option.c, optfunc.c, opttbl.c)
priority.description: Document the options/configuration system. Cover option.c: option parsing and storage; optfunc.c: option handler implementations; opttbl.c: option table definitions. Include: LOPTION structure, how options are registered, default values, option change handlers, and the option table format.

priority.title: Character Set Handling (charset.c)
priority.description: Document charset.c - character set and encoding handling. Cover: charset detection and conversion, UTF-8 handling, wide character support, is_ascii* functions, binary file detection, character width calculations, and integration with Unicode data files.

priority.title: Navigation Features (forwback.c, mark.c, jump.c, position.c)
priority.description: Document navigation-related modules. Cover forwback.c: forward/backward movement logic; mark.c: mark setting and jumping (m, ' keys); jump.c: jump locations and history; position.c: position tracking and caching. Include how these work together for navigation.

priority.title: Output System (output.c)
priority.description: Document output.c - terminal output handling. Cover: output buffering, putchr/pstr functions, control character handling, output flush logic, bell handling, and interface with screen.c for display updates.

priority.title: Terminal Handling (ttyin.c, scrsize.c, os.c)
priority.description: Document terminal-related modules. ttyin.c and scrsize.c are integrated into other documentation. Terminal type detection and termcap/ncurses integration is covered in Display System documentation.

priority.title: Signal Handling (signal.c)
priority.description: Document signal.c - signal handling for less. Signal handling is covered in the Core System documentation (main.c). Signals handled: SIGWINCH, SIGHUP, SIGINT, SIGQUIT, SIGTERM. Safe signal handling with volatile flags.

priority.title: Regular Expression Support (regexp.c)
priority.description: Document regexp.c and regex integration. Cover: which regex library is used (internal vs external), regex compilation interface, pattern matching interface, regex error handling, and how the search engine uses regex.

priority.title: Lesskey Utility (lesskey.c, lesskey_parse.c)
priority.description: Document the lesskey utility for custom key bindings. Cover lesskey.c: main lesskey program; lesskey_parse.c: key binding parser. Include: file format, binding types (command, edit, variable), how less loads and uses key bindings, and the parsing grammar.

priority.title: Testing Framework (lesstest/)
priority.description: Document the lesstest testing framework. Cover: overall architecture, test case format, terminal simulation (term.c), display handling (display.c), environment management (env.c), test execution pipeline, and how to write new tests.

priority.title: Build System (configure, Makefile system)
priority.description: Document the build system. Cover: autoconf setup (configure.ac), Makefile generation, platform-specific Makefiles, defines.h generation, Unicode table generation (mkutable), help file generation (mkhelp), and the complete build process from git to installed binary.
